text: Maybe I could become an influencer and get some sweet sponsorship money

elements.text: Maybe I could become an influencer and get some sweet sponsorship money

text: that introduces the variability of fame/influence into the equation, but the concept still holds: people will watch anything that involves an explanation of skill or process
my favorite example on twitch is poker players
they literally ply six games at a time while explaining their decision making process and reader, it is *wild*
I love it

elements.text: I love it

text: same with video games, right?

elements.text: same with video games, right?

text: totally
you’re just watching somebody do something well. it’s intoxicating.
"competence porn"

elements.text: "competence porn"

text: not even well, it's entertainment too. There are video game streamers who aren't even good

elements.text: not even well, it's entertainment too. There are video game streamers who aren't even good

text: and they're massive

elements.text: and they're massive

text: personality first, then competence I suppose
i’ve always wanted to launch, and this is true, a livestream of people who are intensely high trying to put together ikea furniture
also both, don't have numbers but if you look at Shroud or Ninja they became popular from their skills, then built their audience because they also have personality

text: I was taken with the phrase and googled it; didn’t realize it was already a trope. Has evolved quite a bit since this entry tho: <https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CompetencePorn>

attachments.title: Competence Porn - TV Tropes
attachments.text: Competence porn is a term invented by Leverage writer John Rogers and used by a lot of critics since. It's the thrill of watching talented people plan, …

text: <@UJ48Q1HAP> you a Binging with Babish fan?

elements.text: you a Binging with Babish fan?

text: I actually *just* stumbled on him, so I haven't fallen down the rabbit hole yet. My loyalty to Alison Roman and the entirety of the Bon Appetit test kitchen is undying.

elements.text: I actually
just
stumbled on him, so I haven't fallen down the rabbit hole yet. My loyalty to Alison Roman and the entirety of the Bon Appetit test kitchen is undying.

text: His stuff is fun and it's such an cool concept

elements.text: His stuff is fun and it's such an cool concept

text: Especially when it's -> I made this food just like the show and it's kind of crap -> Let me show you how to make this for real

elements.text: Especially when it's -> I made this food just like the show and it's kind of crap -> Let me show you how to make this for real

text: Something that really impresses me about Bon Appetit from a content standpoint is how successful they've been spinning the basic concept of "good cooks cooking" into so many different shows: You've got the basic Test Kitchen recipe breakdowns, Chris Morocco reverse engineering dishes blindfolded, Claire Saffitz creating gourmet versions of junk food, etc. etc. etc.

elements.text: Something that really impresses me about Bon Appetit from a content standpoint is how successful they've been spinning the basic concept of "good cooks cooking" into so many different shows: You've got the basic Test Kitchen recipe breakdowns, Chris Morocco reverse engineering dishes blindfolded, Claire Saffitz creating gourmet versions of junk food, etc. etc. etc.

text: Such a good example of creativity + focus

elements.text: Such a good example of creativity + focus
